primaryTask: This module is about Adjective Declension in German.

submodules.submoduleContext: Focuses on adjective endings after definite articles (der, die, das, etc.) in different cases (Nominative, Accusative, Dative, Genitive).
submodules.primaryTask: Generate a sentence using definite articles (der, die, das) with adjectives, where the adjective takes the weak declension pattern (-e in nominative singular for all genders, -en in all other cases). The adjective must follow a definite article and demonstrate the correct weak ending.

helpers.title: Weak Declension Table (After Definite Articles)
helpers.content:
| Case       | Masculine | Neuter    | Feminine  | Plural    |
|------------|-----------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Nominative | **-e**    | **-e**    | **-e**    | -en       |
| Accusative | -en       | **-e**    | **-e**    | -en       |
| Dative     | -en       | -en       | -en       | -en       |
| Genitive   | -en       | -en       | -en       | -en       |

*(Remember the "Oklahoma" pattern for the **-e** endings!)*

submodules.submoduleContext: Focuses on adjective endings after indefinite articles (ein, eine, einen, etc.) and possessive determiners (mein, dein, sein, etc.) in different cases.
submodules.primaryTask: Generate a sentence using indefinite articles (ein, eine) or possessive determiners (mein, dein) with adjectives, where the adjective takes the mixed declension pattern (-er/-es/-e in nominative singular depending on gender, -en in all other cases). The adjective must follow an indefinite article/possessive and demonstrate the correct mixed ending.

helpers.title: Mixed Declension Table (After Indefinite Articles)
helpers.content:
| Case       | Masculine | Neuter    | Feminine  | Plural    |
|------------|-----------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Nominative | **-er**   | **-es**   | **-e**    | -en       |
| Accusative | -en       | **-es**   | **-e**    | -en       |
| Dative     | -en       | -en       | -en       | -en       |
| Genitive   | -en       | -en       | -en       | -en       |

*(Note the strong endings -er/-es in the "Oklahoma" pattern where the indefinite article has no ending.)*

submodules.submoduleContext: Focuses on adjective endings when there is no article before the adjective (strong declension), often used with plurals or certain prepositions.
submodules.primaryTask: Generate a sentence using adjectives without any articles, where the adjective takes the strong declension pattern (-er/-es/-e in nominative singular, -en/-em/-er in other cases). The adjective must stand alone (no article) and demonstrate the correct strong ending.

helpers.title: Strong Declension Table (Without Articles)
helpers.content:
| Case       | Masculine | Neuter    | Feminine  | Plural    |
|------------|-----------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Nominative | **-er**   | **-es**   | **-e**    | **-e**    |
| Accusative | **-en**   | **-es**   | **-e**    | **-e**    |
| Dative     | **-em**   | **-em**   | **-er**   | **-en**   |
| Genitive   | **-en**   | **-en**   | **-er**   | **-er**   |

*(Adjective takes the definite article endings, except for Genitive Masc/Neut where it's -en.)*
